text:
It’s been 2-3 years since my childhood dog passed away peacefully from old age, her name was Lexi, she was a redhead golden retriever and she was like a sister to me we would always be together the only time we fought was when I was 9 she was 8 and I dropped a natella jar from the dining table and we fought over it😂
I had this little thing with Lexi with our age, me birthday was before her’s so when I was 12 she was 11 she died the following year when I was 13 she almost made it to 13 years old I loved that dog she was the being that made my childhood so great she will be missed forever but now we have  Dakota who is a standard golden and Grayson a border collie, and now Londyn our new golden girl I feel like she’s Lexi’s reincarnation and I’m happy to think that some of my best friend/dog/sister is with me once again 😌

text:
I lost my father 2 days ago. I didnt even ask him if he's okay when his still alive. He died without me answering his messages or call. Now I regret not telling him that I'm sorry, love him and I already forgive him for what he has done to us (my siblings). It really broke my heart when i saw him before he was cremated. He looks like he's in pain and asking for help but there's no one to help him 😞 I'm so stupid not talking to him and allowing my pride to take over. Now this song hits really harder and it's painful at the same time. I wish he now found the true happiness he's looking for on where he's at now because I know he did'nt find it here.

Tell your parents you love them or forgive them while they're still here because we'll never know when it's too late. Even when you cry your heart out they can't hear you. Trust me, learned it the hard way.

text:
On 8/8/2023, a date etched in my heart, I experienced a loss that words can't capture. My dear Dad, your selflessness knew no bounds, leaving an indelible mark on my life. Each day feels incomplete without your presence, and I miss you endlessly.

Your giving spirit and boundless love touched all who knew you. You've left a void that can never be filled, and your absence is felt deeply. As I navigate daily, your lessons and love remain my guiding light.

Rest in peace, Dad. Your memory lives on in every cherished moment, and your legacy of selflessness will forever inspire me. 🙏💙
